name: andouille
content:

(also andouille sausage) a type of sausage originally made in Louisiana in the United States, containing pork (= meat from a pig) mixed with spices and smoked: Starters include gumbo with chicken, andouille and okra. You can use smoked ham, andouille sausage or any good smoked sausage.
a type of sausage popular in France, made with offal (= inside parts of an animal's body such as the intestine or the inside covering of the stomach): The crepes are stuffed with traditional things like ham and cheese or andouille (tripe sausage). Compare
andouillette
More examplesFewer examplesSausage is almost mandatory in a gumbo; if you can’t get andouille then a good smoked sausage will do. Andouille sausages are spicy Creole-Cajun smoked pork sausages that are aggressively seasoned with red pepper and garlic. Popular Cajun foods include oysters, boudins and andouille sausages. The name nduja is a corruption of the French word andouille, a type of spicy sausage made with offal.Remember that andouilles need plenty of strong spice to contrast with the slightly rubbery smoothness of the tripe.
